alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 09 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is still possible due to the excessive rainfall earlier in the day. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM PDT, flooding was still possible due to the excessive rainfall and runoff from earlier in the day. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Westmorland, El Centro Naval Airfield, Mt. Signal, Mountain Spring, Dixieland, Seeley, Coyote Wells and Heber. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding or washed out roads.
